alert.note: Alert for Bates; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 06 at 9:28AM CDT until June 07 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Osage River near Schell City. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, flood waters impact low lying areas west of Schell City. County roads west and north of Route M become flooded. The Four River Conservation Area 10 miles west of Schell City floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 30.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 25.1 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 930 AM CDT.
